misuse: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
description: The use of the MD5 algorithm is insecure and should not be used for cryptographic purposes due to its high collision rate. It is recommended to use a more secure algorithm such as SHA-256 or SHA-512 instead.
recommendation: Replace the use of the MD5 algorithm with a more secure algorithm such as SHA-256 or SHA-512.
